00034 
00035 pair<list<string>,map<string,valarray<double> > >
00036 load_broad_intensity_map(string ifname)
00037   {
00038 
00039   // List of column names which are sample names
00040   list<string>sample_name;
00041 
00042   // Associate cnv region names with intensity vectors
00043   map<string,valarray<double> >intensity_map;
00044 
00045   // Open the ascii tab delimited input file
00046   TsvFile infile;
00047   if(infile.openTable(ifname) != TSV_OK)
00048       Err::errAbort("Unable to open intensity map file '" + ifname + "'");
00049 
00050 
00051   // Retrieve the set of column names - no error checking for now
00052   infile.nextLevel(0);
00053   for (int k=1; k<infile.getColumnCount(infile.lineLevel()); k++)
00054     {
00055     string column_str;
00056     infile.get(infile.lineLevel(),k,column_str);
00057     sample_name.push_back(column_str);
00058     }
00059 
00060   // Error checking will be easier if I know the number of columns
00061   unsigned long ncol=sample_name.size();
00062 
00063   
00064   while(infile.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK)
00065     {
00066     string cnv_region;
00067     double intensity;
00068 
00069     // load the set of cnv region names
00070     infile.get(infile.lineLevel(),0,cnv_region);
00071 
00072     // a place to put the intensities for a cnv region
00073     vector<double>intensity_vec;
00074 
00075     // go fetch them.
00076     for (int k=1; k<=ncol; k++)
00077       {
00078       infile.get(infile.lineLevel(),k,intensity);
00079       intensity_vec.push_back(intensity);
00080       }
00081 
00082     // store the intensities
00083     valarray<double>vals(intensity_vec.size());
00084     for (int k=0; k<intensity_vec.size(); k++) vals[k] = intensity_vec[k];
00085     intensity_map[cnv_region].resize(vals.size());
00086     intensity_map[cnv_region] = vals;
00087     }
00088 
00089   infile.close();
00090 
00091   return pair<list<string>,map<string,valarray<double> > >
00092          (sample_name,intensity_map);
00093   }
00094 
00095 
00096 map<string,CanaryPrior>
00097 load_broad_prior_map(string ifname)
00098   {
00099   map<string,CanaryPrior>prior_map;
00100 
00101   // Open the ascii tab delimited input file
00102 //cnv_region    P0      P1      P2      P3      P4      M0      M1      M2      M3      M4      V0      V1      V2      V3      V4
00103 //CNP10 0.0076  0.0608  0.9316  0       0       0.3162  0.6032  0.8655  1.1052  1.3243  0.0015  0.001   0.0015  0.0032  0.0047
00104   TsvFile infile;
00105 
00106   string cnv_region;
00107   double p0,p1,p2,p3,p4,m0,m1,m2,m3,m4,v0,v1,v2,v3,v4;
00108   infile.bind(0,"cnv_region",&cnv_region, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00109   infile.bind(0,"P0",&p0, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00110   infile.bind(0,"P1",&p1, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00111   infile.bind(0,"P2",&p2, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00112   infile.bind(0,"P3",&p3, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00113   infile.bind(0,"P4",&p4, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00114   infile.bind(0,"M0",&m0, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00115   infile.bind(0,"M1",&m1, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00116   infile.bind(0,"M2",&m2, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00117   infile.bind(0,"M3",&m3, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00118   infile.bind(0,"M4",&m4, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00119   infile.bind(0,"V0",&v0, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00120   infile.bind(0,"V1",&v1, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00121   infile.bind(0,"V2",&v2, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00122   infile.bind(0,"V3",&v3, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00123   infile.bind(0,"V4",&v4, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00124 
00125   if(infile.open(ifname) != TSV_OK)
00126       Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + ifname + " to read.");
00127 
00128   // Just go through and pick up the region, probabilities, means and variances.
00129   while(infile.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK)
00130     {
00131     valarray<double>prop(5);
00132     valarray<double>mean(5);
00133     valarray<double>var(5);
00134 
00135     prop[0]=p0;
00136     prop[1]=p1;
00137     prop[2]=p2;
00138     prop[3]=p3;
00139     prop[4]=p4;
00140     mean[0]=m0;
00141     mean[1]=m1;
00142     mean[2]=m2;
00143     mean[3]=m3;
00144     mean[4]=m4;
00145     var[0]=v0;
00146     var[1]=v1;
00147     var[2]=v2;
00148     var[3]=v3;
00149     var[4]=v4;
00150 
00151     prior_map[cnv_region] = CanaryPrior(cnv_region,prop,mean,var);
00152     }
00153 
00154   return prior_map;
00155   }
00156 
00157 
00158 double hardy_weinberg(vector<int>cluster_vec,valarray<double>props)
00159   {
00160   CanaryModel CM;
00161   if (cluster_vec == CM["model0"]) return 1.0;
00162 
00163   if (cluster_vec == CM["model2"]) return 1.0;
00164 
00165   if (cluster_vec == CM["model01"])
00166     return hardy_weinberg2(props[0],props[1],0.0);
00167 
00168   if (cluster_vec == CM["model12"])
00169     return hardy_weinberg2(0.0,props[0],props[1]);
00170 
00171   if (cluster_vec == CM["model23"])
00172     return hardy_weinberg2(props[0],props[1],0.0);
00173 
00174   if (cluster_vec == CM["model34"])
00175     return hardy_weinberg2(0.0,props[0],props[1]);
00176 
00177   if (cluster_vec == CM["model012"])
00178     return hardy_weinberg2(props[0],props[1],props[2]);
00179 
00180   if (cluster_vec == CM["model234"])
00181     return hardy_weinberg2(props[0],props[1],props[2]);
00182 
00183   if (cluster_vec == CM["model123"])
00184 //      return hardy_weinberg3(0.0,props[0],props[1],props[2],0.0);
00185         return hardy_weinberg3_bad(0.0,props[0],props[1],props[2],0.0);
00186 
00187   if (cluster_vec == CM["model0123"])
00188 //      return hardy_weinberg3(props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3],0.0);
00189         return hardy_weinberg3_bad(props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3],0.0);
00190 
00191   if (cluster_vec == CM["model1234"])
00192 //      return hardy_weinberg3(0.0,props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3]);
00193         return hardy_weinberg3_bad(0.0,props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3]);
00194 
00195   if (cluster_vec == CM["model01234"])
00196 //      return hardy_weinberg3(props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3],props[4]);
00197         return hardy_weinberg3_bad(props[0],props[1],props[2],props[3],props[4]);
00198 
00199   else 
00200       Err::errAbort("!!!found no model!!!\n");
00201 
00202   return 1.0;
00203   }
00204 
00205 
00206 double hardy_weinberg2(double Naa, double Nab, double Nbb)
00207   {
00208   // Nxx is the proportion multiplied by the count
00209   // Exx is the expected hw value 
00210   // prob_a is the probability of an a allele.
00211   double count = (Naa + Nab + Nbb);
00212 
00213   double prob_a = (2*Naa + Nab)/(2*count);
00214 
00215   double Eaa = count*prob_a*prob_a;
00216   double Eab = count*2.0*prob_a*(1.0 - prob_a);
00217   double Ebb = count*(1.0 - prob_a)*(1.0 - prob_a);
00218 
00219   double statistic = 0.0;
00220   if (Eaa > FLT_MIN) statistic += (Eaa-Naa)*(Eaa-Naa)/Eaa;
00221   if (Eab > FLT_MIN) statistic += (Eab-Nab)*(Eab-Nab)/Eab;
00222   if (Ebb > FLT_MIN) statistic += (Ebb-Nbb)*(Ebb-Nbb)/Ebb;
00223 
00224   return 1.0 - affxstat::chisqrprob(1,statistic);
00225   }
00226 
00227 // N0 - N4 are the counts of observed copy numbers
00228 double hardy_weinberg3(double N0,double N1,double N2,double N3,double N4)
00229   {
00230   double count = N0 + N1 + N2 + N3 + N4;
00231 
00232   double f0 = N0/count; // observed proportion with copy number of 0
00233   double f1 = N1/count; // and so on for f1 - f4
00234   double f2 = N2/count;
00235   double f3 = N3/count;
00236   double f4 = N4/count;
00237 
00238   double p0 = 1.0/3.0; // starting point for iterations
00239   double p1 = 1.0/3.0;  
00240   double p2 = 1.0/3.0;
00241 
00242   double was_p0 = p0; // old values for checking convergence
00243   double was_p1 = p1;
00244   double was_p2 = p2;
00245 
00246   double converge = 0.0000001; // did it converge
00247 
00248   // There probably is a closed form solution for this but instead let
00249   // the computer do the work.
00250   //
00251   // The observed counts with a copy number of 2 can come either from
00252   // a pair of strands with single copies or one strand having a copy
00253   // number of 0 and the other a copy number of 2.  This deconvolution
00254   // causes a loss of 3 degrees of freedom because observed values are
00255   // being imputed from expected values which would not happen with 
00256   // three alleles producing distinct phenotypes for each combination.
00257   //
00258   // The plan is to start with initial values and substitute the unobserved
00259   // proportions with imputed proportions for copy number of 2.  This can 
00260   // probably be written out as an expectation step in an EM algorithm if
00261   // fitting the H-W model to the data.
00262   
00263   double diff;
00264   do
00265     {
00266     p0 = (2.0*f0 + f1 + f2*2.0*p0*p2/(2.0*p0*p2 + p1*p1))/2.0;
00267     p1 = (f2*2.0*p1*p1/(2.0*p0*p2 + p1*p1) + f1 + f3)/2.0;
00268     p2 = (2*f4 + f2*2.0*p0*p2/(2.0*p0*p2 + p1*p1) + f3)/2.0;
00269 
00270         double diff_max = 0.0;
00271 
00272         diff = abs(p0 - was_p0);
00273     was_p0 = p0;
00274     if (diff > diff_max) diff_max = diff;
00275 
00276         diff = abs(p1 - was_p1);
00277     was_p1 = p1;
00278     if (diff > diff_max) diff_max = diff;
00279 
00280         diff = abs(p2 - was_p2);
00281     was_p2 = p2;
00282     if (diff > diff_max) diff_max = diff;
00283 
00284     } while (diff > converge);
00285 
00286   double statistic = 0.0;
00287   double E0 = count*p0*p0;
00288   statistic += (E0-N0)*(E0-N0)/E0;
00289 
00290   double E1 = count*2.0*p0*p1;
00291   statistic += (E1-N1)*(E1-N1)/E1;
00292 
00293   double E2 = count*(2.0*p0*p2 +  p1*p1);
00294   statistic += (E2-N2)*(E2-N2)/E2;
00295 
00296   double E3 = count*2.0*p1*p2;
00297   statistic += (E3-N3)*(E3-N3)/E3;
00298 
00299   double E4 = count*p2*p2;
00300   statistic += (E4-N4)*(E4-N4)/E4;
00301 
00302   return 1.0 - affxstat::chisqrprob(2,statistic);
00303   }
00304 
00305 
00306 // Use this defective version to repeat broad results.
00307 double hardy_weinberg3_bad(double N0,double N1,double N2,double N3,double N4)
00308   {
00309   double count = N0 + N1 + N2 + N3 + N4;
00310 
00311   double f0 = N0/count; // observed proportion with copy number of 0
00312   double f1 = N1/count; // and so on for f1 - f4
00313 //  double f2 = N2/count;
00314   double f3 = N3/count;
00315   double f4 = N4/count;
00316 
00317   double freq0 = (2*f0 + f1)/2;
00318   double freq2 = (2*f4 + f3)/2;
00319   double freq1 = 1.0 - freq0 - freq2;
00320 
00321   double statistic=0.0;
00322 
00323 
00324   double E0 = count*freq0*freq0;
00325   if (E0 > FLT_MIN) statistic += (E0-N0)*(E0-N0)/E0;
00326 
00327   double E1 = count*2.0*freq0*freq1;
00328   if (E1 > FLT_MIN) statistic += (E1-N1)*(E1-N1)/E1;
00329 
00330   double E2 = count*(freq1*freq1 + 2*freq0*freq2);
00331   if (E2 > FLT_MIN) statistic += (E2-N2)*(E2-N2)/E2;
00332 
00333   double E3 = count*2.0*freq1*freq2;
00334   if (E3 > FLT_MIN) statistic += (E3-N3)*(E3-N3)/E3;
00335 
00336   double E4 = count*freq2*freq2;
00337   if (E4 > FLT_MIN) statistic += (E4-N4)*(E4-N4)/E4;
00338 
00339   return 1.0 - affxstat::chisqrprob(2,statistic);
00340   }
00341 
00342 
00343 // Repeats the final fix-it-up step in the Broad Implementation.
00344 BroadEstepper1 directional_impute(CanaryOptions& opts,
00345                                   pair<string,BroadEstepper1> model_pair,
00346                                   CanaryPrior CP)
00347   {
00348   valarray<double> freqs = CP.prop();
00349   string model = model_pair.first;
00350   BroadEstepper1 BE = model_pair.second;
00351 
00352   if ((freqs[3]+freqs[4])==0.0)
00353     {
00354     if (model=="model012") return BE;
00355 
00356     vector<int>cvec_forced;
00357     cvec_forced.push_back(0);
00358     cvec_forced.push_back(1);
00359     cvec_forced.push_back(2);
00360 
00361     if (model=="model0")
00362       {
00363       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(0);
00364       valarray<double>mean(3);
00365       mean[0] = BE.mean(0);
00366       mean[1] = CP.mean(1) + delta;
00367       mean[2] = CP.mean(2) + delta;
00368       
00369       valarray<double>var(3);
00370       var[0] = BE.var(0);
00371       var[1] = CP.var(1);
00372       var[2] = CP.var(2);
00373 
00374       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00375 
00376       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00377       BE1.prop(prop);
00378       BE1.mean(mean);
00379       BE1.var(var);
00380       return BE1;
00381       }
00382 
00383     if (model=="model2")
00384       {
00385       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(2);
00386       valarray<double>mean(3);
00387       mean[0] = CP.mean(0) + delta;
00388       mean[1] = CP.mean(1) + delta;
00389       mean[2] = BE.mean(0);
00390       
00391       valarray<double>var(3);
00392       var[0] = CP.var(0);
00393       var[1] = CP.var(1);
00394       var[2] = BE.var(0);
00395 
00396       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00397 
00398       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00399       BE1.prop(prop);
00400       BE1.mean(mean);
00401       BE1.var(var);
00402       return BE1;
00403       }
00404 
00405 
00406     if (model=="model01")
00407       {
00408       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(0);
00409       delta += BE.mean(1) - CP.mean(1);
00410       delta /= 2;
00411 
00412       valarray<double>mean(3);
00413       mean[0] = BE.mean(0);
00414       mean[1] = BE.mean(1);
00415       mean[2] = CP.mean(2) + delta;
00416       
00417       valarray<double>var(3);
00418       var[0] = BE.var(0);
00419       var[1] = BE.var(1);
00420       var[2] = CP.var(2);
00421 
00422       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00423 
00424       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00425       BE1.prop(prop);
00426       BE1.mean(mean);
00427       BE1.var(var);
00428       return BE1;
00429       }
00430 
00431     if (model=="model12")
00432       {
00433       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(1);
00434       delta += BE.mean(1) - CP.mean(2);
00435       delta /= 2;
00436 
00437       valarray<double>mean(3);
00438       mean[0] = CP.mean(0) + delta;
00439       mean[1] = BE.mean(0);
00440       mean[2] = BE.mean(1);
00441       
00442       valarray<double>var(3);
00443       var[0] = CP.var(0);
00444       var[1] = BE.var(0);
00445       var[2] = BE.var(1);
00446 
00447       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00448 
00449       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00450       BE1.prop(prop);
00451       BE1.mean(mean);
00452       BE1.var(var);
00453       return BE1;
00454       }
00455     }
00456   
00457 
00458   if ((freqs[0]+freqs[1])==0.0)
00459     {
00460     if (model=="model234") return BE;
00461 
00462     vector<int>cvec_forced;
00463     cvec_forced.push_back(2);
00464     cvec_forced.push_back(3);
00465     cvec_forced.push_back(4);
00466 
00467     if (model=="model2")
00468       {
00469       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(2);
00470       valarray<double>mean(3);
00471       mean[0] = BE.mean(0);
00472       mean[1] = CP.mean(3) + delta;
00473       mean[2] = CP.mean(4) + delta;
00474       
00475       valarray<double>var(3);
00476       var[0] = BE.var(0);
00477       var[1] = CP.var(3);
00478       var[2] = CP.var(4);
00479 
00480       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00481 
00482       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00483       BE1.prop(prop);
00484       BE1.mean(mean);
00485       BE1.var(var);
00486       return BE1;
00487       }
00488 
00489     if (model=="model23")
00490       {
00491       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(2);
00492       delta += BE.mean(1) - CP.mean(3);
00493       delta /= 2;
00494 
00495       valarray<double>mean(3);
00496       mean[0] = BE.mean(0);
00497       mean[1] = BE.mean(1);
00498       mean[2] = CP.mean(4) + delta;
00499       
00500       valarray<double>var(3);
00501       var[0] = BE.var(0);
00502       var[1] = BE.var(1);
00503       var[2] = CP.var(4);
00504 
00505       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00506 
00507       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00508       BE1.prop(prop);
00509       BE1.mean(mean);
00510       BE1.var(var);
00511       return BE1;
00512       }
00513   
00514     if (model=="model34")
00515       {
00516       double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(3);
00517       delta += BE.mean(1) - CP.mean(4);
00518       delta /= 2;
00519 
00520       valarray<double>mean(3);
00521       mean[0] = CP.mean(2) + delta;
00522       mean[1] = BE.mean(0);
00523       mean[2] = BE.mean(1);
00524       
00525       valarray<double>var(3);
00526       var[0] = CP.var(2);
00527       var[1] = BE.var(0);
00528       var[2] = BE.var(1);
00529 
00530       valarray<double>prop = fill_prop(opts,BE.prop(),BE.cvec(),cvec_forced);
00531 
00532       BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00533       BE1.prop(prop);
00534       BE1.mean(mean);
00535       BE1.var(var);
00536       return BE1;
00537       }
00538     }
00539 
00540   // Otherwise
00541   return directional_impute_01234(opts,model_pair,CP);
00542   }
00543 
00544 // Repeats the final fix-it-up step in the Broad Implementation for 
00545 // only the full model
00546 
00547 BroadEstepper1 directional_impute_01234(CanaryOptions& opts,
00548                                         pair<string,BroadEstepper1> model_pair,
00549     CanaryPrior CP)
00550   {
00551 //  valarray<double> freqs = CP.prop();
00552   string model = model_pair.first;
00553   BroadEstepper1 BE = model_pair.second;
00554   
00555   if (model=="model01234") return BE;
00556 
00557   vector<int>cvec_forced;
00558   cvec_forced.push_back(0);
00559   cvec_forced.push_back(1);
00560   cvec_forced.push_back(2);
00561   cvec_forced.push_back(3);
00562   cvec_forced.push_back(4);
00563 
00564   if (model=="model0")
00565     {
00566     double delta = BE.mean(0) - CP.mean(0);
00567 
00568     valarray<double> mean(5);
00569     mean[0] = BE.mean(0);
00570     mean[1] = CP.mean(1) + delta;
00571     mean[2] = CP.mean(2) + delta;

00584     BroadEstepper1 BE1(opts,BE.vals(),CP,cvec_forced);
00585     BE1.prop(prop);

00587     BE1.var(var);
00588     return BE1;

00884     }
00885 
00886   Err::errAbort("never should have got here\n");
00887   return BE;
00888   }
00889 
00890 //  Following Broad algorithm which is not documented
00891 valarray<double> fill_prop(CanaryOptions& opts,
00892                            valarray<double>prop_in,vector<int>cvec_in,
00893                            vector<int>cvec_forced)
00894   {
00895   double min_prop = opts.tune_min_fill_prop;
00896   double delta = 0.0;
00897   unsigned int max_pos = 0;
00898   double max_prop = 0.0;
00899   for (unsigned int i=0; i<prop_in.size(); i++)
00900     {
00901     if (prop_in[i] > max_prop) { max_pos = i; max_prop = prop_in[i]; }
00902     if (prop_in[i] < min_prop)
00903       {
00904       delta += min_prop - prop_in[i]; 
00905       prop_in[i] = min_prop; 
00906       }
00907     }
00908   prop_in[max_pos] -= delta;
00909 
00910    
00911   unsigned int nmissing = cvec_forced.size() - cvec_in.size();
00912   double fraction_giveaway = opts.tune_fraction_giveaway_0;
00913 
00914   if (nmissing==1) fraction_giveaway = opts.tune_fraction_giveaway_1;
00915   if (nmissing==2) fraction_giveaway = opts.tune_fraction_giveaway_2;
00916   if (nmissing==3) fraction_giveaway = opts.tune_fraction_giveaway_3;
00917   if (nmissing==4) fraction_giveaway = opts.tune_fraction_giveaway_4;
00918 
00919   double per_cluster_need = fraction_giveaway/nmissing; // divide by zero?
00920 
00921   valarray<double>ret_arr(per_cluster_need,cvec_forced.size());
00922   for (unsigned int i=0; i<cvec_in.size(); i++)
00923     for (unsigned int k=0; k<cvec_forced.size(); k++)
00924       if (cvec_in[i] == cvec_forced[k]) 
00925         {
00926         ret_arr[k] = (1.0 - fraction_giveaway)*prop_in[i];
00927         break;
00928         }
00929 
00930   return ret_arr;
00931   }
00932 
00933 valarray<double> median_polish(Matrix & X, int niter)
00934         {
00935         int N = X.Nrows();
00936         int P = X.Ncols();
00937 
00938         valarray<double>row_med(0.0,N);
00939         valarray<double>col_med(0.0,P);
00940 
00941         double median;
00942         double converge;
00943 
00944         int count=0;
00945         // Probably more samples than probes, so sample(columns) medians first;
00946         do {
00947                 valarray<double>old_row = row_med;
00948                 valarray<double>old_col = col_med;
00949                 // run through the columns(probes)
00950                 for (int j=0; j<P; j++)
00951                         {
00952                         valarray<double> resids(N);
00953                         for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00954                                 resids[i] = X.element(i,j) - row_med[i] - col_med[j];
00955                         col_med[j] += compute_median(resids);
00956                         }
00957 
00958                 // The median of the probe(column) effects should be zero so
00959                 // transfer it over to the row(sample) effects.
00960                 median = compute_median(col_med);
00961                 row_med += median;
00962                 col_med -= median;
00963 
00964                 // run through the rows(samples)
00965                 for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00966                         {
00967                         valarray<double> resids(P);
00968                         for (int j=0; j<P; j++)
00969                                 resids[j] = X.element(i,j) - row_med[i] - col_med[j];
00970                         row_med[i] += compute_median(resids);
00971                         }
00972 
00973                 count++;
00974                 converge=0.0;
00975                 for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00976                         for (int j=0; j<P; j++)
00977                                 {
00978                                 converge += abs(old_row[i] - row_med[i]);
00979                                 converge += abs(old_col[j] - col_med[j]);
00980                                 }
00981 
00982                 if (converge < 0.01) break;
00983 
00984                 } while (count < niter);
00985 
00986         return row_med;
00987         }
00988 
00989 
00990 double compute_median(valarray<double> valvec)
00991         {
00992         unsigned int N = valvec.size();
00993         vector<double>vec(N);
00994         for (unsigned int i=0; i<N; i++) vec[i] = valvec[i];
00995         sort(vec.begin(),vec.end());
00996 
00997         if (N % 2) return vec[(N - 1)/2];
00998         else return 0.5*(vec[N/2 - 1] + vec[N/2]);
00999         }
01000 
01001 
01002 string swap_suffix(string name1, string new_suffix)
01003         {
01004         name1.replace(name1.rfind("."),name1.size(),new_suffix);
01005         return name1;
01006         }
